intro: Paracaryum hirsutum, commonly known as the woolly sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and dense, hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Paracaryum hirsutum is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive, textured appearance.
